title: Solving Systems with Gaussian Elimination
description:
Use Gaussian elimination to solve the following system of linear equations:

**System of equations:**
```
2x + 3y - z = 8
4x - 2y + 3z = 4
3x + y - 2z = 9
```

**Steps to follow:**
1. Write the augmented matrix
2. Use row operations to get the matrix in row echelon form
3. Back-substitute to find the solution
4. Verify your solution by substitution

Show all your work including each row operation performed.
hints: Use row operations: multiply row by scalar, add multiple of one row to another
Aim for upper triangular form (row echelon form)
Check your solution by plugging back into original equations
workbook: HELM Workbook 8 Matrix solution of Equations
